text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I want every child to live
with a perpetual smile,

every teenager to
pursue their dreams,

every adult to reach
their potential,

and every human being to
prosper in good health.

This is why my life's purpose
is to uplift our historically

marginalized communities
and to provide

a voice to people who have been
sidelined for far too long.

Specifically, it's to ensure
that everyone, regardless

of age, gender,
beliefs and religion,

race and ethnicity, language
and socioeconomic status,

has access to high quality
patient-centered health care,

that they can live
a healthy life.

It's also to ensure that people
don't have to think twice

before going to
the doctor because

of a large medical
bill, that they

don't have to decide
between paying their rent,

feeding their children, or
making their annual doctor's

visits, and that they
feel seen and heard

by our social and
health care systems.

But perhaps more importantly,
my life's purpose

is to be a reliable
friend, a caring brother,

a considerate son and, one
day, a good husband and father.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
